page.title: 04The geography of the area
page.content: THIS AREA BETWEEN THE RIVERS SEVERN AND WYE IS ABOUT 180 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL WHICH IS FORMED BY LIMESTONE AND SANDSTONE WHICH GIVE IRONORE AND COAL. THE IRONORE AND THE COAL MADE LOTS OF JOBS FOR THE VILLAGERS.WHEN THEY FIRST STARTED MINING THE IRONORE THEY USED THE OPEN CAST METHOD LIKE PUZZLE WOOD. LATER ON THEY USED THE TUNNELLING SUCH AS CLEARWELL CAVES.MUCH OF THE COAL, IRON,STEEL,TIMBER AND STONE HAD TO BE SHIPPED TO OTHER COUNTRIES SO THEY HAD TO BUILD A RAILWAY TRACK TO LYDNEY DOCKS. BEFORE THE MINING STARTED ALL THE LAND WAS THICK FOREST USED FOR ROYAL HUNTING GROUND.NOW THAT THE MINING HAS FINISHED IT HAS LEFT SLAG HEAPS.THE WORK HAS GOT LIGHTER NOW BECAUSE THERE ARE ONLY 5 WORKS LEFT IN THIS AREA BUT THERE ARE MORE HOUSES NOW.
